oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Centennial Envelope and Receipt showing Children's Building

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Centennial celebrations; Exhibitions; Anniversaries; Fairs; Commemorations; Buildings; Kindergartens; Children; Envelopes
Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition (1897 : Nashville, Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A postal envelope addressed to Prof. A.H. Merrill of Vanderbilt University. In the left corner of the envelope is a sketch of the Children's Building at the Tennessee Centennial Exposition. Included is a receipt for tuition at the model kindergarten.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Centennial and International Exposition Collection, 1895-1900
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Children's Building was located near the Woman's Building. It featured playgrounds and a deer petting zoo. Also, a model kindergarten was located in the building. Professor W.T. Davis, Miss Duncan and Mrs. McHenry taught the kindergarten in which; classes were held throughout the six months of the Exposition.
